entry.title: Bake It ’Til You Make It
entry.summary:
Author: ItsBuckleyTime

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,322Chapters: 22/22Kudos: 26

Summary: It all started with toast. One burned breakfast, one emergency call, and one incredibly handsome firefighter later, Buck’s kitchen reputation is toast—literally. Determined to prove he’s not a walking fire hazard, Buck shows up at Station 118 with cookies… and then keeps showing up. Now there’s a judgmental cat, unsolicited baking advice, cosmic bowling, and way too much eye contact. Can a flustered baker and a teasing firefighter fall in love, one cookie at a time?

entry.title: send me away with the words of a love song
entry.summary:
Author: justhockey

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,311Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 33

Summary: Eddie can feel Buck’s head shaking in the crook of his neck, can feel his hands grasping even tighter in his shirt. Eddie doesn’t know what to do for him - he doesn’t know how he could even begin to make this better. This devastation has been silently festering inside of Buck, and now it’s all pouring out in one heartbreaking confession.Eddie can feel him take a large, gasping breath. And suddenly he knows what Buck is about to say before the words even leave his mouth:“It should have been me.”

entry.title: the autumn chill that wakes me up, you loved the amber skies so much
entry.summary:
Author: deanvrse

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,728Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 44

Summary: “I heard Maddie won’t be walking you down the aisle.” At those words, Buck’s face shifts. The flicker of a smile fades, replaced by something smaller—something quieter. He glances down, avoiding Bobby’s eyes in the mirror. “Yeah,” he says softly. “She’s officiating, so… I guess I’ll just walk myself down the aisle.” He shrugs, trying to play it off like it doesn’t matter, but Bobby sees the way his jaw clenches, the way his shoulders tense again like they’ve been carrying that thought all morning. Bobby’s hands still on the tie. He doesn’t speak right away. “Or—” he says eventually, voice gentle, “I could do it.” Or it’s Buck and Eddie’s wedding day and Bobby is alive

entry.title: You must be redstone, because you activate my heart
entry.summary:
Author: tinypeckers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,946Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck knows a lot of things, like the average person blinks 14 to 17 times per minute or it would take 19 minutes to fall to the centre of the earth, but he doesn’t know how to craft a pickaxe in Minecraft. Or how to play Minecraft. At all.Thankfully, he has Eddie and Chris to help guide him through and what’s a better father-son bonding activity than humouring Buck’s incompetence?Or the fic where Buck learns about dried ghasts and wants to play Minecraft for the first time.

entry.title: Hunger
entry.summary:
Author: asyztole

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,360Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 28

Summary: “You’re…a vampire.” Buck finally breathes out. Astute observation.If Eddie wasn’t so bewildered right now, he’d roll his eyes. Even with this thrilling conclusion, Buck seems awfully okay with this. And that kind of scares Eddie more.“Yes.” Eddie affirms, because what else is there to do?“You’re a vampire and you’ve just eaten.” Another resounding observation from Buck. Does he think he’s dreaming?orEddie and Buck have a “sleepover” that ends in Eddie getting a tasty treat.

entry.summary:
Author: griefbespoke

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,338Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 277

Summary: They're gonna need you. The words haunt Buck the whole way back to the station, to his Jeep, to his house. Nothing else has managed to permeate the fog just yet; nothing else has even come close. All he has is the hurt, so intense for so long now that it almost feels dull, and Bobby's quiet certainty. You. They're gonna need you. 8x15 coda. Buck calls Eddie.

entry.title: Every Story Has A Beginning, Middle, And End But Not Necessarily In That Order
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,979Chapters: 1/15Kudos: 19

Summary: Sometimes love doesn’t knock—it quietly moves in, settles on the couch, makes coffee in the morning, and slips into your heart when you’re too busy dancing around it to notice.And every great story has a beginning, middle, and end. But not necessarily in that order. Nothing in Eddie Diaz’s or Evan Buckley’s life has happened linearly so far, but it has occurred nevertheless. And them falling in love with one another is not another exception.OR:There are better no roommates than Evan Buckley and Eddie Diaz, and there is no state more natural for the pair of best friends than living together under one roof.They have a routine, you see. One they had down before they even lived together, but now that they do, it's like second nature.Buck, Eddie, and Christopher have a long summer ahead of them living in one house. And it’s a season filled with:Kitchen mishaps and New RecipesBarbecues and Family LoveZoo visits and Science CampsHeat Waves and Ballroom DancingA love confession. Or Two?Stolen glances, Secret kisses in their dreamsDangerous Calls That Threaten To Put Everything In PerilAnd so, so much more...

entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,599Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 80

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles.But alas, they trudge on.Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough.Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving.Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on.OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side.Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher.When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children.‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.'And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.
